newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: South American port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: South American port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

ARGENTINA, Nov 26 - Santa Fe - One vessel berthed loading wheat. No vessels in roads, 4 due. Max draft 30 ft. 1 in at access channel. Diamante - No vessels berthed/in roads/due. Max draft 30 ft. 1 in at passage km. 520. San Lorenzo - Five vessels berthed, 2 loading sbm, 1 loading wheat, 2 loading sbmp. 2 vessels in roads, 21 due at 9 terminals during coming week. Max draft 34 ft. 8 in. Forecast to keep rising for next week. Recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel. Pasa berth draft 25 ft fw. Nidera berth draft 34 ft. 6 in fw. Rosario - Six vessels berthed of which 4 awaiting orders, 2 loading sugar. 3 in roads, 9 due during the coming week. Max Recommended draft 34 ft. 8 in. Forecast to keep rising for the next week. Recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel.

Villa Constitucion - No vessels berthed/in roads, 1 vessel due. Max recommended draft 34 ft. 8 in. Forecast to keep rising for the next week. Elevator berths max. draft 22 ft fw. Recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel. San Nicolas - Five vessels berthed of which 1 awaiting orders, 1 loading alcohol, 2 discharging slabs, 1 loading coils, 1 discharging iron ore. 2 Vessels in roads, no vessels due during coming week. Max. recommended draft 34 ft. 8 in. Forecast to keep rising for the next week. Recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel. San Pedro - One vessel loading wheat, no vessels in roads/due. Recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel, 31 ft. 6 in at high tide.

Buenos Aires - 25 vessels in port, 35 due during the week. Max draft 31 ft. 6 in fw high tide NAABSA (guided by entrance channel) Port dock Sud max recommended draft 29 ft. fw. High tide NAABSA (guided by entrance channel). Necochea - One vessel loading fish, 1 in roads, 4 due during week. Max Draft 40 ft. Bahia Blanca - Four vessels berthed of which 1 loading sun pellets, 1 loading sun oil, 1 loading lpg, 1 discharging gas oil. 2 Vessels in roads, 13 due during the coming week. Draft depends on each berth.

BRAZIL, Nov 26 - Vitoria - Vessels berthed, 2 container/general cargo loaders/dischargers, 1 malt discharger, 1 rice discharger, 1 cellulose loader, 1 fruit discharger, 1 cotton discharger. Tubarao - 2 Iron ore loaders. Praia Mole - 3 Steel plates loaders, 1 coal discharger, 1 fertiliser discharger. Portocel - 1 Cellulose loader, 1 flexible tubes (tug). Ubu - 1 Iron ore loader. 14 vessels waiting in roads. Santos - Vessels berthed, 9 full containers, 3 general cargo/containers, 1 bulk cement discharger, 12 sugar loaders, 5 bulk fertiliser dischargers, 2 juice loaders, 2 pellets loaders, 1 salt discharger, 1 cotton discharger, 3 chemical products dischargers, 1 propane discharger, 1 diesel oil loader, 1 sulphur discharger. 26 Vessels waiting in roads, 91 due during next 7 days.

Private terminals - Cosipa - 1 Iron ore discharger, 2 bulk coal dischargers, 1 steel products loader. Ultrafertil - 1 Bulk fertiliser discharger. Rio Grande - Vessels berthed, 5 bulk fertiliser dischargers, 1 full container vessel, 2 soya loaders, 1 lubricant oil discharger. No vessels waiting in roads, 24 due during next 10 days. Paranagua - Vessels berthed, 1 general cargo discharger, 2 fertiliser dischargers, 1 general cargo discharger, 3 sugar loaders, 1 container loader, 1 pellets loader, 1 general cargo loader. 10 Vessels waiting in roads of which for loading, 1 reefer, 4 pellets. For discharging, 2 fertiliser, 1 reefer, 1 container, 1 general cargo. 5 Vessels due during next 7 days. Rio de Janeiro - Vessels berthed, 1 general cargo/steel products discharger, 3 wheat dischargers, 3 steel products dischargers, 1 container/general cargo discharger, 1 steel products/paper discharger, 1 general cargo/steel products loader, 3 steel products loaders, 1 sugar loader, 1 general cargo loader. Tecon - 3 Vessels, 31 due during next 7 days. Sao Sebastiao - Vessels berthed, Tebar 3, 2 vessels waiting in roads, 9 vessels due during next 7 days.

CHILE, Nov 25 - Arica - Three vessels operating, 2 berths vacant, 9 vessels due during week. Iquique - Three vessels operating, 2 berths vacant, 11 vessels due in week. Antofagasta - Three vessels berthed, 3 berths available, 6 due in week for loading and discharging concentrates, copper bulk, containers and general cargo, no vessels in roads. Valparaiso - Two vessels working normally, 6 berths vacant, 1 berth out of service due to enlargement 16 due during week. San Antonio - Seven operating, 1 berth vacant, 10 vessels due in week. Port busy but no waiting time. Conception Bay - Talcahuano - One vessel working normally, 3 due this week, none in roads. San Vicente - Three vessels berthed working normally, no berths vacant, no vessels in roads, 2 due in week. Steel pier - 1 Vessel working normally, 2 due in week. Coronel pier - No vessels. Navy pier (Molo 500) - 1 Berthed, 1 due. Oil terminal - No vessels. Lirquen - Three operating, 1 berth vacant, 1 waiting in roads, 1 due. Penco - No vessels. Puerto Montt - Two vessels at terminal, 1 due in week. Punta Arenas - One vessel and 1 coaster berthed, 2 vessels and coasters, 1 commercial vessel due during week. No vessels in roads.

PERU, Nov 25 - Callao - Eight vessels in bay, 3 in pier (general cargo, containers). No berthing delays. Paita - One general cargo/fishmeal vessel in pier. No delays. Bayovar, Pisco - No vessels. Talara - Two oil vessels in bay. No berthing delays. Chimbote - One fishmeal vessel in bay. No berthing delays. Ilo - One copper vessel in pier. No berthing delays.
VENEZUELA, Nov 25 - Puerto Cabello - Three vessels anchored, 11 berthed of which 5 grain cargo, 2 general cargo, 4 containers. Guanta - One vessel anchored, 1 general cargo berthed.
